inlineContent.text: When you create a product in App Store Connect, you can associate one or more pieces of downloadable content with it. At runtime, when a product is purchased by a user, your app uses
objects to download the content from the App Store.
Your app never directly creates a
object. Instead, after a payment is processed, your app reads the transaction object’s
property to retrieve an array of
To download the content, you queue a download object on the payment queue and wait for the content to be downloaded. After a download completes, read the download object’s

property to get a URL to the downloaded content. Your app must process the downloaded file before completing the transaction. For example, it might copy the file into a directory whose contents are persistent. When all downloads are complete, you finish the transaction. After the transaction is finished, the download objects cannot be queued to the payment queue and any URLs to the downloaded content are invalid.

abstract.text: Support In-App Purchases and interactions with the App Store.
Downloadable content associated with a product.
A string that uniquely identifies the downloadable content.
The length of the downloadable content, in bytes.
The local location of the downloaded file.
Returns the local location for the previously downloaded flie.
A string that identifies which version of the content is available for download.
Deletes the previously downloaded file.
The current state of the download object.
The error that prevented the content from being downloaded.
The length of the downloadable content, in bytes.
A value that indicates how much of the file has been downloaded.
The current state of the download object.
An estimated time, in seconds, to finish downloading the content.
The transaction associated with the downloadable file.
The states that a download operation can be in.
Indicates that the system cannot determine how much time is needed to finish downloading the content.
An array of download objects representing the downloadable content associated with the transaction.
Finish the transaction to complete the purchase process.
Keep a persistent record of a purchase to continue making the product available as needed.
Deliver content to the customer after validating the purchase.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
